dcterms:creator: Markus Puschel
José M. F. Moura
dcterms:description: An algebraic signal model (ASM) defined by the triple (A, M, ρ), where A is an associative algebra with unity, M is a vector space with inner product, and ρ is a homomorphism between A and the set of endomorphisms in M.
dcterms:title: Algebraic Signal Models

dcterms:creator: M. Puschel
J. M. F. Moura
dcterms:description: This dataset provides foundational insights into algebraic signal processing theory, focusing on 1-D time.
dcterms:title: Algebraic Signal Processing Theory

dcterms:creator: M. Puschel
J. M. F. Moura
dcterms:description: This dataset extends the algebraic signal processing theory to 1-D space, providing further insights into its applications.
dcterms:title: Algebraic Signal Processing Theory: 1-D Space

dcterms:creator: J. Kovacevic
M. Puschel
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses sampling methods for infinite and finite 1-D space within the framework of algebraic signal processing theory.
dcterms:title: Algebraic Signal Processing Theory: Sampling for Infinite and Finite 1-D Space

dcterms:creator: Alejandro Parada-Mayorga
Alejandro Ribeiro
dcterms:description: This dataset explores the stability of algebraic neural networks to deformations, providing insights into their robustness.
dcterms:title: Algebraic Neural Networks: Stability to Deformations
